Articles
email
Using bluemail to renew the design and study of enterprise emailhttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g_bKEfwAcNs
enFlash Video5944John C. Tang2008530Bluemail is an email client supporting folders, tags, threads and "orienteering." The IBM team analyzed the use of this prototype: threads are used, tags are not, some people classify all they mails while others classify nothing...
spam
Why Am I Getting All This Spam? Unsolicited Commercial E-mail Research Six Month Reporthttp://www.cdt.org/speech/spam/030319spamreport.shtml
enHTMLthe Center for Democracy & Technology20033A study of where spammers are harvesting email addresses.
Spam, Phishing, and Online Scams: A View from the Network-Levelhttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IBPg9Lyta3A
enFlash Video1618Nick Feamster2008617Trying to detect spam by analysing the sender behaviour on the network rather that the content of the mails.
Search engines
Numbers, Numbers - But What Do They Mean?http://searchenginewatch.com/2162421
enHTMLDanny Sullivan200033Danny describes the meaning of the two sizes publicized by search engines. This is a good introduction on the algorithms used by Inktomi, FAST, Google, Excite...

frHTMLSegi20061014A bad side effect of having your site referred in Wikipedia: spam sites copies Wikipedia pages and so Google believes your site is also a spam site.

enHTMLAlex Genadinik2010113The title says all.

Start Here to learn about Web services - Get a grounding on the basic conceptshttp://www.ibm.com/developerworks/java/library/ws-start.html

Overview of Some Patterns for Architecting and Managing Composite Web Serviceshttp://www.acm.org/sigs/sigecom/exchanges/volume_3_%2802%29/3.3-Benatallah.pdf
enPDFB. BenatallahM.DumasM.-C. FauvetF.A. RabhiQuan Z. Sheng20028An overview of Web services architecture and issues. I know that the design pattern fashion is still much hyped but what is the point to call this "proto-patterns"?
Content feeds with RSS 2.0 - Syndication goes mainstreamhttp://www.ibm.com/developerworks/xml/library/x-rss20/
enHTMLJames Lewin20031223A good overview (schema, readers, feeds, search engines...) of the current state of RSS.

enHTMLKris Zyp2009420A description of Perservere, a JSON storage and JavaScript application server.
Redis - The Hacker's Databasehttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1BS3UVSLX-I
enFlash Video4918Amir Salihefendic2010122The lead developer of Plurk explains why he likes Redis, an in-memory databse.
performance
High Performance Web Sites and YSlowhttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BTHvs3V8DBA
enFlash Video1033Steve Souders20071113Souders describes the importance of the front-end in the performance, the fact that data is most often not cached... Then, he details some of his 14 rules:
Make fewer HTTP requets
Use a CDN
Add an Expires header
Gzip components
Put stylesheets at the top
Move scripts at the bottom
Make JS and CSS external
Minify JS
Avoid redirects
Make AJAX cacheableAt last, he speaks about his tool to check if these rules are respected: YSlow.
Life's Too Short - Write Fast Code (part 2)http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=52gL93S3usU
enFlash Video5552Steve Souders200939Some new rules
Load scripts without blocking
Couple asynchronous scripts
Flush the document early
Use iframes sparinglySouders focuses on the two first bullets, describing several solutions with their pros & cons, since none of them is the best for all situations.
YDN Theater - Julien Lecomte: “High Performance Ajax Applications”http://yuiblog.com/blog/2007/12/20/video-lecomte/
enFlash VideoMP44926Julien Lecomte20071220Some advice on how to write fast AJAX.
Faster HTML and CSS: Layout Engine Internals for Web Developershttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a2_6bGNZ7bA
enFlash Video115David Baron20081117David Baron explains some internals of Firefox that should be taken into account to improve page and script performance.
YUI Theater — Douglas Crockford: "Ajax Performance"http://yuiblog.com/blog/2008/12/23/video-crockford-performance/
enFlash VideoMP43746Douglas Crockford20081223The advices given by Douglas Crockford are basic performance good practices, but his description of applying these to Ajax is clear and effective.
YUI Theater — Nicole Sullivan: "Design Fast Websites (Don’t Blame the Rounded Corners)"http://yuiblog.com/blog/2008/12/23/video-sullivan/
enFlash VideoMP44231Nicole Sullivan20081223How to design a fast site: create a component library, avoid using too many styles, crush images, avoid non-standard browser fonts...
Non-blocking JavaScript Downloadshttp://yuiblog.com/blog/2008/07/22/non-blocking-scripts/
enHTMLStoyan Stefanov2008722Several workarounds to avoid the fact that Browsers download, parse and execute each script before downloading the other components.

enHTMLSteve Souders20087A presentation of Episodes.
Building Fast Client-side Searcheshttp://code.flickr.com/blog/2009/03/18/building-fast-client-side-searches/
enHTMLRoss Harmes2009318A description of how Flickr implemented a very fast auto-completion for the contact list.
Not Just a Pretty Face: Performance and the New Yahoo! Searchhttp://developer.yahoo.com/blogs/ydn/not-just-pretty-face-performance-yahoo-search-7718.html

High Performance JavaScripthttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_fUGWFGUrUw
enFlash Video12235Nicholas ZakasStoyan StefanovRoss HarmesJulien LecomteMatt Sweeney20104A presentation of some well known performance subjects:
- How to limit the slowness of interacting with the DOM
- How to have a responsive interface
- Multipart XHR (transferring many resources – CSS, images... – in a single HTTP request)
- Combining, minifying, compressing, proper management of the Browser cache, using a CDN
- Network analyzers and profilers.
Top 10 Performance Problems taken from Zappos, Monster, Thomson and Cohttp://blog.dynatrace.com/2010/06/15/top-10-performance-problems-taken-from-zappos-monster-and-co/

But it is difficult to find the future next hip technology...
